description: I was in chatge of both contacting current customers as well as making cold calls. I hadled blueprint reading and new/re-model estimates. I also handle the following •Receiving and processing requests directly from customers (via telephone, fax and mail) for price quotations, product availability, customer orders, material returns, billing corrections, product information, order changes, and cancellations •Plan and implement telemarketing and prospecting objectives •Quickly and smoothly resolve customer complaints and problems •Engage in specialty purchasing •Coordinate delivery and/or pick up of customer orders with operations teams •Provide support to Outside Sales force (also serve as a backup for Outside Sales) •Generate price quotations in a timely manner •Maintain adequate supply of product samples and literature •Adhere to pricing guidelines established by Branch Manager •Review all orders to forecast additional customer needs •Interact with sister branches when necessary on inventory issues and deliveries •Work with Replenishers to achieve the best product line •Maintain strong relationships with customers •Maintain adequate stock of Tool Rack items with accurate pricing •Maintain adequate product stock at branch location •Responsible for setup and maintenance of store displays •Sustain a working technical knowledge of all available Allied products •Review job plans and bidding documents for Taper quotes and developing project summaries for Outside Sales personnel

description: Stood Supplementary Plotting Red Database watch for admirals staff for one western pacific deployment after which I was assigned to the training of all new red database managers and was chosen to be one of the intelligence watch standers for the 2008 maritime expeditionary team trainer held for the training of increased coordination between carrier strike groups and amphibious strike groups. Stood Supplementary Plotting enlisted watch supervisor for part of one western pacific deployment after which I was one of two intelligence specialists chosen to be in charge of completing COMTUEX (pre-deployment operations) training with all Nimitz intelligence specialists and was chosen to do all pre and post training operation briefings with 3rd Fleet training officers. During USS Nimitz's 2009 - 2010 Persian Gulf deployment stood as the sole Counter Piracy / White Database supervisor answering directly to the admirals intelligence officer for which I was awarded the Navy and Marine Corps Achievement Medal.

Implemented step-by-step solutions in order to mitigate EMI interference during operations.

Provided timely threat information to the Commanding General and USF-I leadership. Conducted presentations to senior USF-I leadership on threats, directly affecting ISR collection efforts.

description: Delivered electrical systems integration support on the Countermeasure Dispensing System (ALE-47) product line and new product development for integrated data modems. Created electrical schematics and produced detailed technical documentation at the system and component level. Programmed existing and new product testing equipment. Provided electrical integration and debugging as well as training to customers. Interfaced extensively with diverse populations, including customers, vendors, and various departmental groups.  Formulated electrical specifications, developed electrical schematics, and created hardware and interface design documentation.  Created test equipment for a Countermeasure Dispenser Tester using LabWindow. Programmed various testing equipment for remote control. Created Test Procedure and Verification documentation.  Conducted steps to identify and prevent EMI to the high current electrical system used by the ALE-47 as well as its interface to the aircraft.  Worked with all functional supervisors to identify and replace obsolete parts of a system  Worked on technical documents identifying ALE-47 compliance to different military component standards  Successfully integrated COTS and electrical systems onto fixed and rotary wing aircrafts as a Field Engineer.

title: Electrical Engineer Intern
name: Sebastian Mierzwa
description: Served as an integral member of the New Product Development team; participated in research and development activities. Implemented embedded software architecture of low power and memory on remote data acquisition systems.  Key contributor on matrix team for commercial data, VoIP, WAN, LAN, wireless, and fiber optics, facilitating a secure and reliable integrated network.  Performed firmware programming on MSP430F2xx Processor using C/C++ programming.
